item.title: Shovel Knight Dig - Official Console Launch Trailer
item.description: Don't miss the official console launch trailer for Shovel Knight Dig, which is now available on PC, Xbox, PlayStation 5, Nintendo Switch, and Apple Arcade.

item.title: MindsEye - Official Gameplay Teaser Trailer
item.description: MindsEye is a story-driven action-adventure game developed by Build A Rocket Boy. Watch the official gameplay teaser trailer here.

item.title: New Starfield Deal Lets You Get the Game for Super Low Price
item.description:
Summary

  • Starfield is being offered at a 75% discount through a surprising deal with Verizon, selling physical Xbox Series copies for $17.50.
  • The game's community remains skeptical about its value despite the low price, highlighting disappointment with lackluster content.

A brand-new Starfield deal offers the space-based action RPG to players at its lowest price yet, but the game’s community is surprised to learn which source is supplying the sale. Unfortunately, Starfield didn’t receive the launch Bethesda was hoping for and currently stands with mostly negative reviews as of 2025. Players have reported several bugs plaguing gameplay and a lack of well-functioning features to make space exploration immersive enough.

Starfield was first launched back in 2023, flaunting an open world within the Milky Way galaxy for players to discover mysterious artifacts. Starfield announced its May 2025 update patch notes recently for beta testers, focusing on new quality-of-life features and bug fixes. While the update didn’t supply any new content, it did feature improvements to performance on lower-end PCs and fixed several gameplay glitches, as well as support for creators by adding new icons and the ability to upload larger creations.

Starfield ’s latest and surprisingly cheap deal comes from the Verizon store, which is offering the game for $17.50 on physical Xbox Series X and S copies only, similar to another stellar Walmart deal that a Starfield fan spotted last year. Since the title is usually costing its standard price of around $69.99, this is a massive 75% saving, but the gaming community was confused as to why a store that normally sells mobile phones and internet savings was offering the deal. Considering the massive discount does not have a time limit, it would be wise for interested parties to take advantage of the sale sooner rather than later, in case the offer doesn’t last long.

Starfield Discounted to $17.50 Through New Verizon Deal

Despite the generous offer, a majority of gamers still didn’t believe Starfield was worth the discounted price, but some were persuaded by the free shipping offer. However, the majority of social media comments were questioning why Verizon is now selling games. Since players have felt disappointed by the title’s lack of engaging content, the modding scene has been making up for Bethesda’s shortfall, such as offering over 300 missions within a Starfield mod.

On a brighter note, Starfield ’s PlayStation 5 port has been teased for a 2025 release, according to a reporter who predicted the port would arrive in tandem with the game’s next big expansion. It was noted that the PS5 version would have originally been planned to accompany 2024’s Shattered Space DLC, and the gaming community has become restless in recent months, waiting for new information on the in-demand port.

item.title: Call of Duty: Black Ops 6 Teases Return of Two Iconic Weapons for Season 4
item.description:
WARNING: This article contains spoilers for the campaigns of Black Ops Cold War and the Modern Warfare reboot series.

Summary

  • Call of Duty teases the return of two iconic weapons for Season 4.
  • The LC10 Submachine Gun and FFAR Assault Rifle are expected to return in the upcoming season.
  • Season 4 of Black Ops 6 and Warzone is rumored to begin later this month.

A new teaser trailer for Call of Duty: Black Ops 6 and Warzone Season 4 has teased the return of the LC10 Submachine Gun and the FFAR Assault Rifle. Season 4 of Call of Duty: Black Ops 6 and Warzone is rumored to begin at the end of the month, once again introducing a brand-new Battle Pass filled with weapons and other exclusive cosmetic items for players to get their hands on.

With just a couple of weeks left until the expected start date for Season 4, publisher Activision has officially begun teasing the major content update. The first cinematic video not only seemingly confirmed the return of two iconic weapons but also hinted at a fan favorite Call of Duty character coming back from the dead. The short trailer shows Adler enlisting the help of Vikhor "Stitch" Kuzmin, who many believed to be dead following the events of Black Ops Cold War ​​​​​. This isn't the first time that Call of Duty has brought back deceased characters for new seasons, as Modern Warfare characters such as John "Soap" MacTavish and Phillip Graves have also returned after being killed in the series' main campaign.

Call of Duty Season 4 Trailer Teases Returning Weapons

While the new outro cinematic for Call of Duty Season 3 had a heavy focus on Stitch making his return, some eagle-eyed viewers noticed that the short trailer seemingly confirms the return of two iconic weapons: the LC10 Submachine Gun and the FFAR Assault Rifle. The former of the two weapons has only been seen in Black Ops Cold War , while the FFAR has had multiple iterations over the years. It first made its debut as the FAMAS in 2009's Call of Duty: Modern Warfare 2 and has reappeared as the FFAR in titles such as Call of Duty: Black Ops 3 , Call of Duty: Black Ops Cold War ​​​​​​, and more.

Further details on the upcoming season are still scarce, but fans can likely expect to find numerous new Multiplayer maps, game modes, operator skins, and more to check out. Traditionally, developers Treyarch Studios and Raven Software also have numerous events planned throughout the course of a new season. Season 3 brought two weed-themed events to the game, sparking controversy among the community for its repetitiveness. For unknown reasons, Call of Duty recently extended its High Art event for an additional week, giving fans even more time to level up the controversial Event Pass.

Fans are also hoping to see a decent number of bug fixes in the upcoming update, as Season 3 Reloaded received backlash from the community for the sudden increase in cheaters and bugs in the shooter. One player even recently encountered a strange bug that put a Zombie into the Warzone gulag. It's unclear how the bug occurred, but this is just one of the many issues that seems to have been introduced with the game's mid-season update earlier this month.

item.title: Minecraft's Happy Ghast May Have Opened the Floodgates for Unusual Mounts
item.description:
Besides forcing fans to rethink their theories about Minecraft lore, the introduction of the rideable Happy Ghast might also pave the way for more unusual and unexpected mobs to be updated as new mounts for players. As Mojang continues to revisit some of Minecraft 's most basic features, such as adding biome variants to its Cow, Chicken, and Pig mobs, it seems Ghasts are the latest classic mob to receive an overhaul. After serving as an ever-present danger in the Nether since their introduction to Minecraft in 2010, its newest content drop transforms the unlikely Ghast into one of the Overworld's friendliest and most useful mounted mobs.

But Mojang's decision to single out Ghasts as a new player mount could be a sign of like-minded updates yet to come, especially for Minecraft 's more unusual and even traditionally hostile mobs. Given how far Mojang has expanded the Happy Ghast's abilities, such as accommodating up to four players and carrying leashed boats or mobs, it opens up new opportunities for other potential mounted mobs with equally unique features. From the simpler possibilities of mounted water-based mobs to riding previously hostile mobs, Mojang has only scratched the surface after its recent Happy Ghast.

Minecraft's Happy Ghast Should Lead To More Mob Mounts

While Mojang could have easily reworked any other existing mobs as a new mount for Minecraft , such as Cows, Sheep, or even Sniffers, choosing the typically hostile Ghasts required multiple steps to "tame" them, from finding or crafting Dried Ghasts to submerging them in water. However, given how useful Minecraft 's Happy Ghast can be for players building, transporting, or traveling through the air, Mojang should consider going to similar lengths with other mobs to introduce more unexpected features, such as those listed below.

  • Dolphin
  • Turtle
  • Guardian
  • Ravager
  • Hoglin
  • Zoglin
  • Spider
  • Phantom

Minecraft Could Introduce New Aquatic Mounts

Water is arguably one of Minecraft 's most underserved areas regarding rideable mobs, as beyond boats and the Dolphin's Grace effect, players may struggle to explore underwater without the likes of water-breathing potions or respiration enchantments. Following the Happy Ghast's example, however, Mojang could address this imbalance with new water-based mob mounts, allowing players to use the mobs' existing abilities or by taking inspiration from other Minecraft mounts. For instance, adding a Dolphin mount to Minecraft could capitalize on its grace effect and travel faster than standard boats.

Meanwhile, a Turtle mount could allow players to both dive underwater and grant a longer duration of air in line with Minecraft 's existing turtle shell helmets. Alternatively, like Mules, Llamas, or Boats with Chests, multiple tamed Turtles could be leashed together and equipped with chests for additional storage when traveling across water. However, Guardians could be the most creative, potentially generating a similar effect to conduits around the player and their friends, and even defending players from Drowned, just as tamed Wolves would on land.

Minecraft Could Add New Mob Mounts For Combat

Another area Minecraft could rework is combat in terms of rideable mounts, both for PvE and PvP, especially when mobs such as Ravagers feature saddles as part of their design but can only be ridden by Illagers. But just like the hostile Ghast, Mojang could introduce a new method for either taming or raising a friendly Ravager, which players can ride and attack using its charge ability. Similarly, Hoglins and Zoglins could also be tamed as part of a focus on combat, and could even require a bit of strategy to ensure Hoglin mounts remain in the Nether and Zoglin mounts in the Overworld or End.

Minecraft Could Experiment With Other Ghast-Like Mob Mounts

Like the Happy Ghast, Mojang could instead look further afield for mobs that are least likely to be updated with mounts, particularly those that could offer more unique in-game abilities and mechanics. For example, just like Skeletons, players could ride Spiders and capitalize on their ability to climb walls, an ability that could revolutionize Minecraft 's core gameplay around mining and exploring underground. Beyond that, Mojang could even redeem Minecraft 's controversial Phantoms by allowing players to tame and ride them as an earlier alternative to flying without Elytra or Happy Ghasts.

6 Images
6 Images
